bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reservations Manager, Hotel Nacional, September 19, 1951

div1.p: Hench reserves a room at Havana's Hotel Nacional. He has been invited to participate in a medical congress in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reservations Manager, Hotel Nacional, September 19, 1951
div1.opener:
September 19, 1951
Reservations Manager
Hotel Nacional
Havana, Cuba
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Doctor and Mrs. Howard Gray, Mrs. Hench and I expect to arrive in Havana
Sunday morning, January 20, by the over-night boat from Miami and wish to
spend a week or so at the Hotel Nacional, probably leaving the hotel
Sunday, January 27, for a few days at Varadero Beach.

I have been invited to participate in a medical congress to be held at
Havana the week of January 20. I understand that the University of
Havana is arranging this congress, although my invitation came from
Dr. Tom D. Spies of Birmingham, Alabama, who travels to Havana every
few weeks to carry on some work at the University Hospital in Havana.
Doctor Spies and I have been having some correspondence regarding this
matter and three or four weeks ago he assured me that he or one of his
friends in Havana would make reservations for us at the Hotel Nacional
for the week of January 20. However as I have heard nothing definite, I
think I had better write you directly about this.

Doctor and Mrs. Gray and the Henches would like, if possible, two nice
twin bed rooms each with bath. It would be very pleasant and comfortable
for us if we could have connecting rooms. I have had the pleasure of
visiting your hotel on several occasions, but this is the first trip for
Doctor and Mrs. Gray; therefore I think it would be nice if we could have
rooms facing the ocean. We are physicians and therefore would like
moderate priced rooms, not your most expensive rooms.

Would it be possible for us now to engage a cabana at the swimming pool?
Although I shall be attending medical meetings, the ladies will probably
spend much time at the pool. On my last visit to your hotel there were
no cabanas available when I tried to rent one after we got there.

Will you kindly let us know the approximate rate of our rooms and one cabana
for a week and confirm this reservation directly to me?
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Carbon copy to Doctor Gray
